intro: Bothriocline pectinata, commonly known as the woolly star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
